alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 05 at 10:24PM PST until January 06 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM FRIDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 22 to 27 feet will gradually subside overnight. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Northern Humboldt Coast, Southwestern Humboldt, and Mendocino Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM Friday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Beachcombing is highly discouraged! PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Large breaking waves along the coast will lead to increased wave run-up on beaches with waves topping and washing over large rocks and jetties. These large waves can be erratic and unpredictable. Use extra caution near the surf zone as these large waves will be capable of sweeping people into the frigid and turbulent ocean water. Mariners traversing the bar are urged to exercise extreme caution or stay in port until the threat subsides. Please contact the U.S. Coast Guard for information regarding harbor and bar closures.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt
